issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The scenario is as follows: I had a 4.0 setup with a single frontend.  I then added a secondary compute node and later deregistered the original compute component.  Now, I still see that the original endpoint is attempted first in calls even though the COM_53 component is no longer registered.  In checking the eucalyptus_config db config_component_base table I can see that there is still the legacy /services/Eucalyptus component present.

Debug output from describe command showing first attempting to use the 10.111.5.53 deregistered endpoint before trying the next.
{code}

comments.body: It is expected that the Eucalyptus service is always present. If you change the available services you will need to refresh / update your environment accordingly (eucarc, etc)

Even after the service was deregistered (in fact ran euca-deregister-compute a couple times) describe services still showed some endpoints of the deregistered node.

Describe services after "euca-deregister-compute COM_53"
{code}
[13:43:15] [a-11 | 10.111.5.53 ]: euca-describe-services
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.111.5.53    	ENABLED   	25  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.111.5.53/

SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_53          	ENABLED   	25  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_53/
SERVICE	objectstorage  	objectstorage  	OSG_53         	ENABLED   	25  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:objectstorage:objectstorage:OSG_53/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	LB_53          	ENABLED   	25  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:LB_53/

SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	WS_53          	ENABLED   	25  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/Walrus 	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:WS_53/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.111.5.53    	ENABLED   	25  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.111.5.53/

Get credentials still populates EC2_URL with the deregistered host dns name.
{code}
export EC2_URL=http://compute.a-11.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/compute
{code}

I attempted to restart eucalyptus-cloud service on the "clc". Now describe service has changed some endpoints to the added compute node URL, however now there are 2 eucalyptus services (one for the deregistered compute node and one for the added compute node) and the de-registered compute service has returned to view. We have 1 Eucalyptus service enabled and 1 disabled.
{code}
[16:19:18] [a-11 | 10.111.5.53 ]: euca-describe-services

SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	AS_53          	ENABLED   	54  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:bootstrap:autoscaling:autoscaling:AS_53/

SERVICE	compute        	compute        	COM_53         	DISABLED  	54  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_53/
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	COM_60         	ENABLED   	54  	http://10.111.5.60:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_60/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	LB_53          	ENABLED   	54  	http://10.111.5.53:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:LB_53/

[~sjones], is this still relevant after {{be80c9d EUCA-8710,EUCA-8924,EUCA-9103: Service Registration Operations}}?
[~decker], I will check if this issue is addressed once EUCA-7151 is fixed.

This issue is addressed by existing changes in 4.0.

I tested with the new registration commands:

{code}
# euca-register-service --partition compute --type compute --host 10.111.1.16 COM_16
Created new partition 'compute'
SERVICE	compute           	compute   	COM_16               	http://10.111.1.16:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_16/
# euca-deregister-service COM_16
SERVICE	compute           	compute   	COM_16               	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_16/
{code}

These commands should be run on the coordinator (the host with the active Eucalyptus service)
